questions.question: The critical damping in a two-degree-of-freedom system:

answers.a: Prevents oscillation and brings the system to rest quickly
answers.b: Allows the system to oscillate indefinitely without damping
answers.c: Balances the forces acting on the suspension components
answers.d: Increases the natural frequency of the system

questions.question: Which of the following factors can affect the ride comfort of a two-degree-of-freedom system?
The concept of "pitching" in a two-degree-of-freedom system refers to:

answers.a: Up and down motion of the vehicle's nose and tail
answers.c: Forward and backward motion during acceleration and braking
answers.d: Rotation of the vehicle around its vertical axis

questions.question: The damping ratio in a two-degree-of-freedom system determines:

answers.a: The total mass of the vehicle
answers.b: The amplitude of oscillations in the primary motion mode
answers.c: The speed at which the suspension responds to bumps
answers.d: The frictional resistance in the drivetrain

questions.question: The purpose of shock absorbers in a two-degree-of-freedom system is to:

answers.a: Support the weight of the vehicle
answers.c: Control the oscillations of the suspension system
answers.d: Generate power for the electrical system
